intro: Sida piraporana, commonly known as the Brazilian mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features soft, hairy leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Sida piraporana is also valued for its potential medicinal properties.
